message_1: How many ways are there to choose 2 out of 7 different colors of shirts to wear for a week?
message_2:
To choose 2 out of 7 different colors of shirts, we can use the combination formula, which is:

C(n, k) = n! / (k!(n-k)!)

where n is the total number of items (in this case, 7 different colors of shirts), k is the number of items we want to choose (in this case, 2), and ! denotes the factorial function (e.g., 5! = 5 × 4 × 3 × 2 × 1).

So, for this problem, we have:

C(7, 2) = 7! / (2!(7-2)!)

C(7, 2) = 7! / (2!5!)

C(7, 2) = (7 × 6 × 5 × 4 × 3 × 2 × 1) / ((2 × 1)(5 × 4 × 3 × 2 × 1))

C(7, 2) = (7 × 6) / (2 × 1)

C(7, 2) = 42 / 2

C(7, 2) = 21

So, there are 21 ways to choose 2 out of 7 different colors of shirts to wear for a week.
